Package ModuleTransaction.Orgcom

Interface Entity

All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicEntity
public interface Entity
The entity interface provides the functionality of an entity in the system. The entities have a UUID (universally unique identifier), a name, a district and tokens. The UUID is used to identify the entity in the system. The name is the entity name. The name should not be null or Empty. The district is the entity district. The district is a value from the District enumeration. The tokens are the entity tokens. The tokens are a value that allows the entity to process the transactions in the organization ledger. An entity cannot have negative tokens. The default number of tokens is 0.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int addTokens​(int tokens)
    Adds to the tokens of the entity.
    java.lang.String getDistrict()
    Returns the district of the entity.

    Returns the name of the entity.
    int getTokens()
    Returns the amount of tokens the entity has.
    java.lang.String getUUID()
    Returns the UUID of the entity.
    void spendToken()
    Decrement by one the tokens of the entity.

    • addTokens

      int addTokens​(int tokens)
      Adds to the tokens of the entity.
      Parameters:
      tokens - the number of tokens to add.
      Returns:
      the resulting number of tokens.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of tokens is negative.

    • spendToken

      void spendToken()
      Decrement by one the tokens of the entity.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the resulting number of tokens would result in a negative number of tokens.
